item.title: Ticket #1696 (WYSIWYG editor stripping tags) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Cannot replicate. Could have been a transient issue. Keep in mind that wp.com is very much a work in progress, with active development. In particular, sanitization of html has been worked on, so you may have just caught it at a bad time.

item.title: kubrickheader.php attached to Ticket #1703
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: wp-content/themes/default/images/kubrickheader.php

item.title: Ticket #1703 (Kubrick could use a dynamic header image generator) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: At Matt's suggestion, here is a PHP script that generates a Kubrick header. It goes in the directory where kubrickheader.jpg resides. A request for kubrickheader.php or kubrickheader.php?upper=69aee7&lower=4180b6 will be served a jpg almost indistinguishable from kubrickheader.jpg. Change the upper and lower arguments to alter the gradient colors. Servers without the required GD library installed will redirect to kubrickheader.jpg.

item.title: Ticket #1699 (Finish cache and add array and object support in wp_postmeta) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: We have to be careful about escaping data in the lower functions so that we don't end up double escaping. Our policy right now is to escape at the top level (such as GPC) and pass everything down already escaped. Adding escapes to add_post_meta() and friends could result in double escaping and break the assumptions made by existing plugins.

item.title: Ticket #1701 (iframe post preview) updated

item.title: Changeset [2904]: Pass along grant state when saving cap. Props Owen. fixes #1702
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Pass along grant state when saving cap. Props Owen. fixes #1702

item.title: Ticket #1702 ($grant setting in WP_Role->add_cap() not stored) created
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
WP_Role->add_cap() accepts a $grant parameter with a default, but does not pass that default on to the functions that make the value permanent.

Line 87 should be: $wp_roles->add_cap($this->name, $cap, $grant);

item.title: perfect-preview.diff attached to Ticket #1701
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Patch for latest WP 1.6 SVN

item.title: Ticket #1701 (iframe post preview) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Replaces the current post preview with an iframe showing the actual post in the blog. Many people have been wanting this.

Also adds "preview" and "edit" anchor links so that you can quickly jump between them. Apply the patch, try it out. Works well for me on Safari and Firefox.

item.title: 1700.diff attached to Ticket #1700
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: classes.php diff

item.title: Ticket #1700 (Sub-post objects are returned in every query) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: Starting to use objects in wp_posts now, so we're going to have to exclude them from the usual queries. I made WP_Query slightly aware of objects, enough so it won't show them unless instructed via $wp_query->is_object.

item.title: Changeset [2903]: Uppercase, please.
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: Uppercase, please.

item.title: 1699.diff attached to Ticket #1699
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: diff for wp-includes/functions.php

item.title: Ticket #1699 (Finish cache and add array and object support in wp_postmeta) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Post objects are going to need to store single arrays in wp_postmeta. This diff adds support for arrays and objects, just like in wp_options. This will be needed for the image uploading widget that I have created for the advanced editing form.

While I was in there I knocked out the rest of the post meta caching code.

A suggestion if you wanted to do it, make a plugin that does $_SERVERREMOTE_ADDR? = $_SERVERHTTP_PC_REMOTE_ADDR?.

item.title: Ticket #1684 (No trailing slash for WordPress/Blog Address (URI)) closed
item.dc:creator: shorty114
item.description: invalid

item.title: Ticket #1684 (No trailing slash for WordPress/Blog Address (URI)) updated
item.dc:creator: shorty114
item.description:
The trailing slash is taken out because WP does $blog_uri.'/wp-whatever.php', so it adds the trailing slash.

It works fine on my subdomain (I'm on ASO), so maybe TD should look into it.
